page.title: 07MADLEY EARTH STATION Pt3
page.content: Madley's first three aerials are 32m in diameter - the biggest so far built for British Telecom. They receive microwaves in the 4GHz region from satellites in geostationary orbit 22300 miles above the equator, and transmit to them at 6GHz. With rapid technological advances the size of dish used in the last two aerials is only 19m. The amplifiers can also deal with higher frequencies - receiving at 11GHz and transmitting at 14GHz - which means that greater number of telephone channels can be dealt with. The five aerials at present provide for 12000 simultanious telephone calls and 10 television channels. A smaller 5.5m aerial is used to provide supervision and monitoring of traffic on ECS1, a European satellite.
